description:
Google builds and operates a sophisticated network of data centers globally. Fundamental to this global computing network is a reliable, scalable, and sustainable power supply. In this role, you will be part of the team responsible for Google’s data center site selection and global energy portfolio, where you will work at the forefront of some of the most challenging energy and infrastructure issues of the day.

As the Carbon Free Energy Lead, you'll help lead our long-term efforts to ensure that Google’s data centers and operations operate on carbon free energy. This role will require you to help develop overall carbon free energy-related strategy development and execution, individual strategic initiatives and projects, and work with energy teams across the company in support of Google's data center portfolio and related infrastructure. You will help Google deliver carbon-free energy data centers at all times.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Technology, Engineering, Science, Finance, Economics, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience working with electric utilities, energy companies and carbon free energy solutions (e.g., technology, investment, development).

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA and/or Master’s degree.
  • Ability to creatively solve ambiguous multi-stakeholder challenges.
  • Ability to thrive in environments with ambiguity and uncertainty.
  • Ability to build successful relationships with executive presence.
  • Excellent presentation and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Work with leadership and the wider team to build a 24x7 carbon free energy strategy to support Google's portfolio of data centers and related assets.
  • Collaborate with teams, to identify, define and pursue new strategic energy-related projects and initiatives necessary to meet Google's future 24x7 carbon-free power supply needs goals.
  • Lead negotiations and project management activities for key projects and initiatives including creating, building and managing business relationships with third-parties to find mutually beneficial solutions.
  • Network within Google to help build broad strategies across teams, especially those working on energy.
title: Carbon Free Energy Lead, Data Centers
